member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnReceiveMessageDataHandler
member.summary: Used to receive a deserialized OSC message from the corresponding OSC Link event.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnReceiveBundlesDataHandler
member.summary: Used to receive a deserialized OSC bundle (consisting of deserialized OSC messages) from the corresponding OSC Link event

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnReceivePacketBinaryHandler
member.summary: Used to receive a serialized OSC packet (in its binary form) from a corresponding OSC Link event

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnSendMessageHandler
member.summary: Used to get copies of OSC messages sent by OSC Link, in their deserialized form (for debugging and logging, for example)

member.name: T:OscLib.OscOnSendBundlesHandler
member.summary: Used to get copies of OSC bundles sent by OSC Link, in their deserialized form (for debugging and logging, for example)

member.name: T:OscLib.LinkMode
member.summary: Designates whether the OSC link is currently closed, connected to a specific endpoint or can exchange messages with several endpoints

member.name: T:OscLib.OscLink
member.summary: Used to send and receive OSC messages over UDP. Can operate in two modes: targeted to one specific endpoint, or wide-open free-for-all.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.Name
member.summary: Returns the name of the OSC Link.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.IsOpen
member.summary: Returns whether the OSC Link is currently open.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.OwnEndPoint
member.summary: Returns the end point at which OSC Link is located.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.TargetEndPoint
member.summary: Returns target EndPoint when OSC Link is in target mode, otherwise returns null.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.Mode
member.summary: Current mode of operation.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.CallReceivedDataEvents
member.summary: Controls whether the received messages/bundles will trigger ReceivedAsData events

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.CallReceivedBinaryEvents
member.summary: Controls whether the received messages/bundles will trigger ReceivedAsBinary events

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.CallSentDataEvents
member.summary: Controls whether the sent messages/bundles will trigger Sent events

member.name: P:OscLib.OscLink.UdpClientMaxBufferSize
member.summary: Returns maximum buffer size for the internal UDP client, in kb.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.MessageReceivedAsData
member.summary: Invoked when OSC Link receives a message, passes it as deserealized data.

member.summary: Invoked when OSC Link receives a bundle, passes it as deserealized data.

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.PacketReceivedAsBinary

member.name: E:OscLib.OscLink.MessageSent
member.summary: Invoked when OSC Link sends a bundle, passes it as deserialized data

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.Open

member.summary: Opens a link to specific target address and port (only sending and receiving messages from that target), using random available port.

member.exception: Thrown when provided EndPoint is null.
Thrown when OSC Link is already open.

member.summary: Opens a link to specific target address and port (only sending and receiving messages from that target), using specified port.
member.param: Port number open the OSC Link with.
The OSC Link will only send and receive data with this address.
member.exception: Thrown when provided EndPoint is null.
Thrown when OSC Link is already open.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.OpenWide
member.summary: Opens a link that can send to and receive from any address and port, using a random available port.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.OpenWide(System.Int32)
member.summary: Opens a link that can send and receive from any address and port, using a specific port.
member.param: Port number for the OSC link.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscLink.Close
member.summary: Closes the OSC link.

member.summary: Sends an OSC packet to the target end point the link is connected to.
member.exception: Will throw if OSC link is not in target mode.

member.summary: Sends a message to specified end point.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSender`1
member.summary: Implements a multi-priority sender queue to work with an OSC Link, for message bundling and orderly sending. OSC Link needs to be in targeted mode.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.IsActive
member.summary: Shows whether the sender is currently running.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.ProcessPacketHeapTaskStatus
member.summary: Shows the current status of the ProcessPacketHeap task.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.BundlePacketsBeforeSending
member.summary: Controls whether this sender will bundle OSC data it gets into bundles, or will just send it as separate messages.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.CycleLengthMs
member.summary: Controls how often the packet heap is checked and processed, in milliseconds.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscSender`1.PacketMaxLength
member.summary: Controls the maximum allowed length for outgoing OSC data packets.

member.summary: Activates the sender and connects it to a link.
member.param: The OSC Link the sender is sending messages through.
member.exception: Is thrown when the provided OSC Link is null.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.Deactivate
member.summary: Deactivates the sender, cancelling the heap processing task and disattaching the sender from the OSC Link.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetTimestampSourceMethod(OscLib.TimestampSource)
member.summary: Used to provide the delegate method for bundle timestamp creation.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetPacketReadyCheckerMethod(OscLib.PacketReadyChecker{`0})
member.summary: Used to provide the delegate method for checking whether the conditions are right for the particular packet to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SetPacketRemoverMethod(OscLib.PacketRemover{`0})
member.summary: Used to provide the delegate method for checking whether the particular packet needs to be removed from the heap.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.SendOscPacket(`0@)
member.summary: Immediately sends the OSC binary data packet straight through the OSC Link.
member.typeparam: OSC data packet can be of any type that implements the IOscPacketBinary interface.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to send data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapHead(`0@,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Inserts the packet to the beginning of the heap at the specified priority level.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be last in line.
Also, this method is slower than adding to heap tail.
member.param: The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapTail(`0@,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds the OSC packet to the end of the heap at the specified priority level.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be first in line.
This method is faster than adding to heap head.
member.param: The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.AddOscPacketToHeapTail(`0,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Adds the OSC packet to the end of the heap at the specified priority level.
Important to note: heap levels are processed tail-to-head, so the packet added by this method will be first in line.
This method is faster than adding to heap head.
member.param: The priority level of the packet, with 0 being the highest priority.
member.exception: Thrown when attempting to add data while the sender is not active.
Thrown when the size of the binary data packet is too large to be sent.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSender`1.ProcessHeapLevel(System.Int32)
member.summary: Processes one level of data heap and sends either bundles or messages according to the setting.

member.name: T:OscLib.IOscPacketBinary
member.summary: Describes a structure that contains an OSC packet in binary form.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscBundle
member.summary: Represents a deserialized OSC message bundle. In a slight deviation from the spec, this struct CANNOT contain other bundles.
member.remarks: the idea behind this is that when deserializing incoming bundles, the bundles contained within other bundles are extracted (should their timestamps not be less than that of the enveloping bundle). They are then dealt with according to their timestamps and the configuration of the OscReceiver. The reason for it working the way it works is to 1) have both messages and bundles represented as structs, and 2) avoid using interfaces. All to do with boxing/unboxing and avoiding the dreaded gc pressure as much as possible.

member.name: F:OscLib.OscBundle.HeaderLength
member.summary: The length of the bundle header in bytes. That is, the "#bundle " + [timestamp] bit.

member.summary: Messages inside this bundle.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscBundle.Length
member.summary: Length of this bundle in bytes.

An array of OSC messages to be contained within this bundle.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscSerializer
member.summary: Translates OSC messages and bundles into binary packets, serializing it to be sent over the network.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.MessageToBinary(OscLib.OscString,System.Object[])
member.summary: Creates a binary packet of OSC data using the provided address string and arguments.
member.param: The address string (can be a full address or a pattern)
The arguments (should be of supported types, obviously)
member.returns: An OSC-compliant binary packet containing the message.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.BundleToBinary(OscLib.OscPacketBinary[])
member.summary: Creates a binary packet of OSC data that is a bundle, containing all provided packets, timestamped for immediate execution on receipt.
member.param: OSC binary packets to be bundled up.
member.returns: An OSC binary packet containing the bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.BundleToBinary(OscLib.OscTimestamp,OscLib.OscPacketBinary[])
member.summary: Creates a binary packet of OSC data that is a bundle, containing all provided packets, using the provided timestamp.
member.param: The timestamp to stamp the bundle with.
OSC binary packets to be bundled up.
member.returns: An OSC binary packet containing the bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.BundleToBinary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Packs the preformatted binary data into an OSC packet and adds the right header. Make sure the data *is* OSC-compliant, that is, use at your own risk.
member.param: The preformatted, OSC-compliant binary data, hopefully.
member.returns: An OSC binary packet containing the bundle.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts an integer into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Int32,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts an integer into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process, and returns the OSC type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a float into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Single,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts a float into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process, and returns the OSC type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a double into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Double,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts a double into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process, and returns the OSC type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a string into an ASCII byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.String,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts a string into an ASCII byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.GetArgumentLength(System.String)
member.summary: Returns the OSC protocol-compliant byte length of the string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Converts a string into an ASCII byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(OscLib.OscString,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts a string into an ASCII byte array, and returns the OSC type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.GetArgumentLength(OscLib.OscString)
member.summary: Returns the OSC protocol-compliant byte length of the string.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Converts a byte array into a OSC protocol-compliant binary blob.
member.returns: A binary blob - still a byte array but correctly formatted.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Byte[],System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts a byte array into a OSC protocol-compliant binary blob, and returns the type tag.
member.returns: A binary blob - still a byte array but correctly formatted.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.GetArgumentLength(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Returns the OSC protocol-compliant length of the byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a bool into byte representations of 1 if true and 0 if false.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Boolean,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts a bool into byte representations of 1 if true and 0 if false, and returns the type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Int64)
member.summary: Converts a longint into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary(System.Int64,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts an longint into a byte array, swapping its endianness in the process, and returns the OSC type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.TimestampToBinary(OscLib.OscTimestamp)
member.summary: Converts an OSC timestamp into a byte array.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.TimestampToBinary(OscLib.OscTimestamp,System.Byte@)
member.summary: Converts an OSC timestamp into a byte array, and returns the OSC type tag.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.ArgumentToBinary``1(``0,System.Byte@)
member.summary: The catch-all method to serialize OSC-supported arguments into byte arrays.
member.param: Will return the OSC type tag for the provided argument.
member.returns: The byte array containing the argument.
member.exception: Thrown when the argument is of an unsupported type.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscSerializer.GetArgumentLength``1(``0)
member.summary: The catch-all method to get OSC-supported argument lengths in bytes.
member.param: The argument to check the byte length of.
member.exception: Thrown when the argument is of an unsupported type.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscTime
member.summary: Manages timing and timestamps. Provides a session tick for ease of timekeeping.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.SessionTick
member.summary: Provides the number of ticks elapsed since the first call for this class.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.GlobalTick
member.summary: Provides the current "global" UTC tick.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.Immediately
member.summary: Provides the OSC-compliant "DO IT. DO IT NOW." timestamp.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.ImmediatelyBytes
member.summary: Provides a "pre-rendered" byte representation of the OSC-compliant "DO IT NOW" timestamp.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.Now
member.summary: Provides an OSC timestamp representing the current time (as far as the system is aware).

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTime.NtpEpochStart
member.summary: The start of the current NTP epoch - 00:00 01/01/1900 at the moment.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTime.AfterSeconds(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns an OSC timestamp that occurs after the provided number of seconds has passed.

member.name: T:OscLib.OscTimestamp
member.summary: Contains a timestamp in ways understandable both by OSC (NTP-style) and C# (DateTime ticks)

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.NtpTimestamp
member.summary: This timestamp represented in NTP format.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.Ticks
member.summary: This timestamp represented as DateTime ticks, UTC.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.DateTime
member.summary: Returns a DateTime representation of this timestamp, corresponding to the local time of the system. Creates a new DateTime, so careful with that GC, Eugene.

member.name: P:OscLib.OscTimestamp.DateTimeUtc
member.summary: Returns a DateTime representation of this timestamp, as UTC time. Creates a new DateTime, so careful with that GC, Eugene.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.#ctor(System.DateTime)
member.summary: Creates an OSC timestamp out of the provided DateTime.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.#ctor(System.Int64)
member.summary: Creates an OSC timestamp using DateTime or TimeSpan ticks. Ticks need to be UTC in order to produce right results.

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.#ctor(System.UInt64)
member.summary: Creates an OSC timestamp out of an NTP-format timestamp.
member.param: An ulong containing NTP timestamp (seconds in the first 32 bits, fraction in the following 32 bits)

member.name: M:OscLib.OscTimestamp.ToString
member.summary: Returns timestamp as string (in a "day/month/year hours:minutes:seconds:milliseconds format)
